data.text:
@nilikm @NinjaBellFencer @DFisman @imgrund @ASD_South @DavidElfstrom @FurnessColin @deonandan @SharkawyMD But the comment about one of them not being an MD:

MDs aren't necessarily experts on all things pandemic nor politics.

It was only b/c of my (non-MD) advocacy that Etches came to admit that COVID rates in Ottawa schools were higher than in the general community.

and re masks: https://t.co/dUlaz8dhez

@nilikm @NinjaBellFencer @DFisman @imgrund @ASD_South @DavidElfstrom @FurnessColin @deonandan @SharkawyMD I understood her tweet - her, as a teacher in NB - to be asking those men in leadership to amplify *hers* (the one your replied to, but didn't retweet) of an on-the-ground detailed POV about what is happening in schools in NB.

One of the six men did, and that's how I saw this...

@imgrund @ASD_South Not real good at math eh? 300 per 100,000 is less than 1/3 of 1%. So in a school of 300 kids (for example) .9 kids would have Covid. With a reproduction rate of ~1 means they would give it to one other kid. Look out! It’s gonna get us all!
@SFZaphod @imgrund @ASD_South You mean to be responsible citizens and consider other members of the community? And to take care of your body when it’s not well? Please lol.

@alanahkyleen @imgrund @ASD_South We are teaching the body how to develop the immune system.
We are teaching our children not to behave as we have the last two years where we have basically brought back the Leper's bell.
@imgrund @ASD_South A runny nose and a little cough are not Covid symptoms though.
@imgrund @ASD_South And this tweet might be the dumbest one I've seen during covid
@imgrund @ASD_South Our @Gov_NB has completely abandoned it’s citizens. It’s disgusting.
